traceability.evidence: • Core modules implemented under src/maintenance with corresponding tests passing (detect.ts, update.ts, batch.ts, report.ts), achieving overall test coverage ~97%. • Tests validate detection of stale annotations, single update operations, batch empty mappings, verify true on valid annotations, and report generation for stale annotations. • Missing tests and implementation for several acceptance criteria: – No CLI entrypoint or commands provided for maintenance operations (story requests “Implement CLI tools for common maintenance operations”). – No user-facing feedback mechanism (console output or logs) to indicate what changed during operations. – No documentation (README or user guide) with usage examples and best practices for these tools. – Error handling is minimal (permission errors bubble up, no graceful reporting of edge cases like circular references). – No support for reversal (“reversible operations”) or undo capability as per REQ-MAINT-SAFE. – verifyAnnotations lacks a test for returning false when stale annotations exist. • No integration with ESLint plugin infrastructure or Git hooks as suggested in the story.
traceability.notes: While core detection, update, batch, verify and report functions exist and are tested, key user experience, CLI integration, documentation, error handling, and safety requirements from the acceptance criteria remain unimplemented.
